original_title: Pakistani national gets suspended imprisonment for possessing Indian Rupees
original_body_lines: A Pakistani national who pleaded guilty to possessing and smuggling 361 Rs.500 Indian currency notes was today sentenced to two-year-rigorous imprisonment suspended for seven years by the Colombo High Court.
The accused, Mohamed Thaheer was further ordered to pay a fine of Rs.50,000 by Colombo High Court Judge Damith Thotawatte.

The accused had been arrested by the CID on or around July 15, 2013, in Colombo while possessing and smuggling 361 Rs.500 Indian currency notes. The Attorney General had filed indictments against the Pakistani national in this regard. (Lakmal Sooriyagoda)
